By converting her [[chakra]] into paper, [[Konan]] transforms her body (and clothing) into numerous sheets of paper; the initial creation and dispersal of the paper can mesmerise opponents.<ref name="d3"/> Konan then controls and shapes the paper into various things, such as spears for attack,<ref name="c371">''Naruto'' chapter 371, pages 14-15</ref> [[Wikipedia:Origami|origami]] butterflies for spying,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 371, pages 8-9</ref> and [[Paper Clone|clones]] for supplementary purposes.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 430, page 14</ref> She can create paper wings on her back to fly (though she can hover without them) and use them to [[Paper Drizzle|shoot paper in rapid succession]].<ref name="c372">''Naruto'' chapter 372, pages 4-7</ref> She can also wrap her target in paper, restricting their movements and asphyxiating them.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 422, page 2</ref>

Konan's paper is affected in similar ways as normal paper: [[fire]] will burn it<ref name="c371" /> and [[Toad Oil Bullet|oil]] will cause it to stick together, preventing her from manipulating it.<ref name="c372" /> [[Pain]] is at one point shown ending the rains of [[Amegakure]] so that she can use her paper more freely,<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 368, pages 12-13</ref> but she is later seen using her paper despite the rain.<ref>''Naruto'' chapter 509</ref>

== Trivia ==
* [[Wikipedia:Shikigami|Shikigami]], when written as 式神, refers to a kind of spirit summoned to serve an [[Wikipedia:Onmyōdō|onmyōji]], a kind of sorcerer. These spirits are often depicted as changing into small pieces of paper once harmed or finished with their task. In the name of this technique, the kanji for {{translation|"god"|神|kami}} has been replaced with the kanji for {{translation|"paper"|紙|kami}}, which is pronounced the same. This is likely done to emphasise the paper nature of Konan's shikigami and to point out the subtle difference between them and traditional shikigami.
* Her ability to make wings out of paper mirrors her title as "[[Nagato|God]]'s Angel" in [[Amegakure]].<ref name="c371" />
